title: Liverpool set to sell Daniel Sturridge in the summer after Jurgen Klopp loses patience with striker's injury record
text:
Liverpool set to sell Daniel Sturridge in the summer after Jurgen Klopp loses patience with striker's injury record The German has conceded that his striker does not play enough games Share Sturridge's injury record has got the better of Klopp (Photo: Alex Livesey) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp will sell Daniel Sturridge in the summer after becoming frustrated with the striker’s injury record. 
Klopp has conceded that the 27-year-old England international doesn’t play enough games for him to have a future at Anfield. 
Klopp recognises Sturridge can be one of the Premier League’s most potent goalscorers when fully fit. 
But since signing four years ago injuries have restricted the player to just 111 appearances where he has scored 59 goals. 
Now the Reds chief believes the end of the season is the right time to let Sturridge go and bring in more attacking power. Injuries have blighted Sturridge's last two seasons (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Many former players who still attend Liverpool games have become increasingly frustrated with a player who they believe refuses to push himself through the pain barrier when any problems develop. 
Klopp would love to bring former striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang from Borussia Dortmund but the £70million rated Gabon international is also on the wish list of the likes of Real Madrid, Manchester City and Chelsea.
